result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandi A. Sattler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Added to current payment plan.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  State moved to amend Count 1 to J. Co. Ordinance, Poss drug para.  9.14.  Granted.  Plead no contest  $50.00 fine, plus costs.  $267.50.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid. ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared for Attorney Poss.  Defendant did not appear in the afternoon for STC.   State requests warrant.

Pre-trial conference at 09-09-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Poss.    Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered.  PTC 9/9/15 & STC 9/28/15 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video,  in custody from the jail.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant advised to contact SPD.  AIA set for 8/17/15 at 9:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-17-2015 09:30 am
